alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 4:39AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...PERIODS OF RAINFALL WILL CONTINUE ACROSS ANCHORAGE THROUGH TONIGHT... An additional 0.20" to "0.30" is expected for the Anchorage Bowl Saturday morning through Saturday night. This is due to the persistent moist, southwest flow aloft around an upper level low. Rainfall should taper off by Sunday morning with just a few lingering showers around for Sunday. The additional rain today could push small streams and creeks to, or slightly above, bankfull. Smaller rivers could see water levels rise to bankfull; however, water levels along larger rivers are expected to remain below bankfull. In urban areas, ponding of water and localized flooding on poorly drained roadways is also possible. Please use caution when driving or when recreating along or on area waterways. For additional information and updates to forecasts, please visit www.weather.gov/afc
